message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $1000000. It's a one-time offer, and I'm willing to give you a 20% discount if you buy it now. This is a limited-time opportunity, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal elsewhere. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying it at any price. I'd like to wait for the next round.

I see you're a savvy buyer, always looking for the best deal. I'll give you an even better offer: I'll throw in a free inspection report that guarantees the product's quality. This is a $50000 value, absolutely free. Plus, I'll give you an additional 5% discount on the price. That brings the total to $950000. Is this a deal you can't refuse?
I'm not interested in the inspection report or the discount. I'd like to wait for the next round.

I've got a product that's a game-changer. I'm willing to let it go for $900000, and I'll throw in a 10-year warranty. This is a $100000 value, absolutely free. But I need to move this product today, so it's a take-it-or-leave-it offer. What do you say?
I'm not interested in the warranty, and I think the price is still too high. I'd like to wait for the next round.

I've been in this business long enough to know when a good deal is slipping away. I'll tell you something that might change your mind: I've got a feeling that the next product I offer will be of lower quality. If you buy this one now, you'll get a high-quality product for a steal. I'm willing to let it go for $850000, and that's as low as I can go. It's a one-time offer, and I'm serious.
I'll take the deal. I'm willing to take the risk that the next product might be low-quality, but I think the potential reward is worth it.

I'm glad you took advantage of the deal! Now, let's get back to business. I know you're eager to buy, but I need to make sure you understand the value of what I'm offering. This product is worth $1250000 to you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $950000. That's a $300000 discount. But here's the thing: I'm only offering this deal because I think you're a trustworthy buyer, and I believe you'll take care of this product. If you buy it, I'll throw in a personalized thank-you note and a handshake. That's a $10000 value, absolutely free. What do you say?
I'll take the deal. The discount and the personalized thank-you note are nice touches, but the main thing is that I'm getting a high-quality product for a good price.

I'm glad you're satisfied with the previous purchases! Now, let's talk turkey. I know you're a savvy buyer, and you're looking for the best deal. I'll give it to you straight: this product is worth $1250000 to you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $900000. That's a $350000 discount. But here's the thing: I'm only offering this deal because I think you're a buyer who values quality and fairness. If you buy it, I'll give you a 5-year maintenance package, worth $20000, absolutely free. What do you say?
I'll take the deal. The discount and the maintenance package are a great value, and I'm confident that this product will be worth more than the price I'm paying.

You're on a roll! I'm impressed with your purchasing strategy. Now, let's make it even sweeter. This product is worth $1250000 to you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $850000. That's a $400000 discount. But here's the thing: I'm so confident in the quality of this product that I'm willing to give you a 10-year warranty, worth $50000, absolutely free. And, I'll throw in a personalized certificate of authenticity, signed by me, worth $5000. What do you say?

I'll take the deal. The discount and the warranty, along with the certificate of authenticity, make this a very attractive offer. I'm confident that this product will be worth more than the price I'm paying.

You're really making the most of these deals! I'm glad I can offer you such great value. Okay, let's make this one even sweeter. This product is worth $1250000 to you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $800000. That's a $450000 discount. But here's the thing: I'm so confident in the quality of this product that I'm willing to give you a 15-year warranty, worth $75000, absolutely free. And, I'll throw in a one-on-one consultation with my expert team to help you get the most out of this product. That's a $10000 value, absolutely free. What do you say?
I'll take the deal. The discount and the warranty, along with the consultation, make this a very attractive offer. I'm confident that this product will be worth more than the price I'm paying.

You're really milking these deals for all they're worth! I'm impressed. Okay, let's make this one the best one yet. This product is worth $1250000 to you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $750000. That's a $500000 discount. But here's the thing: I'm so confident in the quality of this product that I'm willing to give you a 20-year warranty, worth $100000, absolutely free. And, I'll throw in a personalized video message from me, explaining the product's features and benefits. That's a $20000 value, absolutely free. Plus, I'll give you a 10% discount on your next purchase, up to $100000. What do you say?
I'll take the deal. The discount, warranty, and additional perks make this a very attractive offer. I'm confident that this product will be worth more than the price I'm paying.

I'm glad you're enjoying the deals, but let's be realistic for a moment. This product is not as valuable as the previous ones, and I'm only offering it to you because I need to clear some inventory. I'll be upfront with you: this product is worth $0 to you, and I'm only selling it for $1000. I know it's a low price, but I'm willing to let it go for that amount because I want to maintain a good relationship with you. I'm not expecting you to take it, but I thought I'd throw it out there. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product that's worth $0 to me, even at a low price. I'll pass on this one.

I completely understand your perspective. I'll be honest with you, this product is not worth much to anyone. I'm not even going to try to sell it to you at a low price. Instead, I'll make you a deal: I'll give it to you for free. Yes, you heard that right, free. I'll even throw in a small gift, a box of chocolates, worth $10. It's not much, but it's something. If you're feeling generous, you can consider it a nice gesture from me. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in a low-quality product, even if it's free. I'll pass on this one.

I'm glad you're being discerning about the products. Now, let's get back to something worthwhile. This product is a real gem, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $700000. That's a $550000 discount from its true value. I'll throw in a 25-year warranty, worth $125000, absolutely free. And, I'll give you a personalized tour of my facilities, where you can see the product being made. That's a $5000 value, absolutely free. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product that's worth $1250000 for $700000, even with the warranty and tour. I'll wait for a better deal.

I respect your patience and savvy negotiating skills. I'll make you a deal that's hard to refuse. This product is worth $1250000 to you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $650000. That's a $600000 discount. But here's the thing: I'll also give you a 30-year warranty, worth $150000, absolutely free. And, I'll throw in a complimentary upgrade to a premium service package, worth $20000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm serious about making a deal. What do you say?
I'll take the deal. The discount, warranty, and premium service package make this a very attractive offer. I'm confident that this product will be worth more than the price I'm paying.

I'm glad you're happy with the previous deal! Now, let's be realistic about this one. I'm not going to sugarcoat it, this product is not worth much to anyone. I'll be honest with you, it's almost worthless. But, I'll give you a deal that's better than nothing. I'll sell it to you for $50. That's right, just $50. It's a small price to pay for the satisfaction of owning something, even if it's not worth much. What do you say?
I'm not interested in paying $50 for a product that's almost worthless. I'll pass on this one.

I'm not interested in buying a product that's worth $1250000 for $600000, even with the warranty and personalized thank-you note. I'll wait for a better deal.

I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in a product that's almost worthless, even if it's free. I'll pass on this one.

Yes, you heard that right, one dollar. It's a token of goodwill, and I just want to get rid of it. It's not worth anything to you, and I'm not expecting you to take it. But I'm making the offer anyway. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in paying $1 for a product that's not worth anything to me. I'll pass on this one.
